chemoreception.notes: Nematodes generally rely on chemoreception for navigation, prey detection, and mate finding. Inferred to be present in Anatonchidae.

mechanoreception.notes: Nematodes possess mechanoreceptors for sensing touch, pressure, and movement in their environment. Likely used for navigating soil and interacting with prey.

vision.notes: Vision is generally absent in nematodes. If present in any species of Anatonchidae, it would be a rare and specialized adaptation.
